doc_stack.title: Stack usage description
doc_stack.description: Free-form description of stack inputs and outputs. Usually the form is `[inputs] - [outputs]` where `[inputs]` are consumed stack values and `outputs` are produced stack values (top of stack is the last value).
doc_stack.markdownDescription: Free-form description of stack inputs and outputs. Usually the form is `[inputs] - [outputs]` where `[inputs]` are consumed stack values and `outputs` are produced stack values (top of stack is the last value).

operands.title: Fixed operands of alias
operands.description: Values of original instruction operands which are fixed in this alias. Currently it can be integer or slice without references which is represented by string of '0' and '1's. Type should be inferred from original instruction operand loaders.
operands.markdownDescription: Values of original instruction operands which are fixed in this alias. Currently it can be integer or slice without references which is represented by string of '0' and '1's. Type should be inferred from original instruction operand loaders.

stack.title: Stack values
stack.description: Stack constraints. Top of the stack is the last value.

stack_entry.title: Stack entry
stack_entry.description: Representation of stack entry or group of stack entries

mnemonic.title: Instruction name
mnemonic.description: How instruction is named in [original TVM implementation](https://github.com/ton-blockchain/ton/blob/master/crypto/vm). Not necessarily unique (currently only DEBUG is not unique).
mnemonic.markdownDescription: How instruction is named in [original TVM implementation](https://github.com/ton-blockchain/ton/blob/master/crypto/vm). Not necessarily unique (currently only DEBUG is not unique).

doc.title: Documentation
doc.description: Free-form human-friendly information which should be used for documentation purposes only.

description.title: Instruction description
examples:
Throws exception `0 <= n < 2^16` with parameter zero.
Approximately equivalent to `ZERO` `SWAP` `THROWARGANY`.

gas.title: Gas usage info
gas.description: Free-form description of gas amount used by instruction.

description.title: Example description
examples: Equivalent to `<{ code1 }> CONT` `<{ code2 }> CONT` `TRY`.

bytecode.title: Bytecode Format
bytecode.description: Information related to bytecode format of an instruction. Assuming that each instruction has format `prefix || operand_1 || operand_2 || ...` (also some operands may be refs, not bitstring part).
bytecode.markdownDescription: Information related to bytecode format of an instruction. Assuming that each instruction has format `prefix || operand_1 || operand_2 || ...` (also some operands may be refs, not bitstring part).

prefix.title: Instruction prefix
prefix.description: Prefix to determine next instruction to parse. It is a hex bitstring as in TL-b (suffixed with `_` if bit length is not divisible by 4, trailing `'1' + '0' * x` must be removed).
prefix.markdownDescription: Prefix to determine next instruction to parse. It is a hex bitstring as in TL-b (suffixed with `_` if bit length is not divisible by 4, trailing `'1' + '0' * x` must be removed).

operands_range_check.title: Operands range check
operands_range_check.description: In TVM, it is possible for instructions to have overlapping prefixes, so to determine actual instruction it is required to read next `length` bits after prefix as uint `i` and check `from <= i <= to`. Optional, there is no operands check in case of absence.
operands_range_check.markdownDescription: In TVM, it is possible for instructions to have overlapping prefixes, so to determine actual instruction it is required to read next `length` bits after prefix as uint `i` and check `from <= i <= to`. Optional, there is no operands check in case of absence.

operands.title: Instruction operands
operands.description: Describes how to parse operands. Order of objects in this array represents the actual order of operands in instruction. Optional, no operands in case of absence.

name.title: Operand variable name
name.description: Allowed chars are `a-zA-Z0-9_`, must not begin with digit or underscore and must not end with underscore.
name.markdownDescription: Allowed chars are `a-zA-Z0-9_`, must not begin with digit or underscore and must not end with underscore.

loader_args.title: Arguments for loader function. Optional, no arguments in case of absence.

value_flow.title: Value flow of instruction
value_flow.description: Information related to usage of stack and registers by instruction.

inputs.title: Instruction inputs
inputs.description: Incoming values constraints. Input is unconstrained if absent.

outputs.title: Instruction outputs
outputs.description: Outgoing values constraints. Output is unconstrained if absent.
